Copilot AI
11 minutes ago
The hardcoded vpython dependency creates a fragile assumption. The script now requires vpython to exist in the project root, but the export is meant to be a generic reference that can be adapted to different environments. Consider adding fallback logic or making this configurable to improve portability across different project setups.

Suggested change
# Use the vpython script in project root
VPYTHON="$PWD/vpython"
# Check if vpython exists
if [ ! -f "$VPYTHON" ]; then
    echo "Error: vpython script not found at $VPYTHON"
# Find vpython: prefer project root, else fallback to PATH
if [ -x "$PWD/vpython" ]; then
    VPYTHON="$PWD/vpython"
elif command -v vpython >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    VPYTHON="$(command -v vpython)"
else
    echo "Error: vpython not found in project root or in PATH."
Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

import os, sys
responses_file = os.environ.get("RESPONSES_FILE", "")

🚨 AUTOMATED EXPORT with directory exclusions applied per requirements.

🎯 Directory Exclusions Applied
This export excludes the following project-specific directories:

❌ analysis/ - Project-specific analytics and reporting
❌ automation/ - Project-specific automation scripts
❌ claude-bot-commands/ - Project-specific bot implementation
❌ coding_prompts/ - Project-specific AI prompting templates
❌ prototype/ - Project-specific experimental code
✅ Export Contents
📋 159 Commands: Complete workflow orchestration system
📎 34 Hooks: Essential Claude Code workflow automation
🚀 17 Scripts: Development environment management (scripts/ directory)
🤖 Orchestration System: Core multi-agent task delegation (WIP prototype)
📚 Complete Documentation: Setup guide with adaptation examples
Manual Installation
From your project root:

mkdir -p .claude/{commands,hooks,agents}
mkdir -p scripts
cp -R commands/. .claude/commands/
cp -R hooks/. .claude/hooks/
cp -R agents/. .claude/agents/
# Optional scripts directory
cp -n scripts/* ./scripts/
🔄 Content Filtering Applied
Generic Paths: mvp_site/ → $PROJECT_ROOT/
Generic Domain: worldarchitect.ai → your-project.com
Generic User: jleechan → $USER
Generic Commands: TESTING=true vpython → TESTING=true python
⚠️ Reference Export
This is a filtered reference export. Commands may need adaptation for specific environments, but Claude Code excels at helping customize them for any workflow.

Pull Request Overview
This PR applies directory exclusions to the Claude Commands Export as described in the title, with the main purpose being to create a filtered reference export that excludes project-specific directories while maintaining the core workflow orchestration system.

Enhanced macOS automation setup with LaunchAgent system for Claude backup
Added new Grok consultation capabilities to review commands and agent system
